instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_RESET: What is SMC_RESET? SMC_RESET is not a signal, it is an abbreviation for “SMC_RESET_L”, which is the signal someone is referring to when they type “SMC_RESET”  "SMC_RESET_L is a signal that resets the SMC when it is low(this is what the “_L” prefix means), and lets the SMC out of reset mode when it is high. .
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Turns on but no green light.
threads.message: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with liquid damage around SMC and <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET</SIGNAL>. Replaced SMC and it now turns on but powers off about halfway though booting into OS and does not show a green light. Will not turn off if just sitting in boot menu or ASD EFI. Possible Bad SMC?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Turns on but no green light.
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Turns on but no green light.
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Turns on but no green light.
threads.message: So it turns off randomly halfway through boot? This one's going to be fun if thats the case.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Turns on but no green light.
threads.message: Yep. But only when booting into OS X. It will sit on the boot menu screen for hours or in ASD EFI. Another thing weird is it will not show sensor test in ASD EFI.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Turns on but no green light.
threads.message: Almost want to say SMC is screwed up software wise but I don't know.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Turns on but no green light.
threads.message: Could be anything. Corrosion on clock chip, <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> area and FETs?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Turns on but no green light.
threads.message: <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> and Clock chip look clean. Tried another SMC and same issues.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Turns on but no green light.
threads.message: I don't know, it must be a corroded resistor/trace somewhere.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Turns on but no green light.
threads.message:
Go check out why there is no green light, thats probably the only clue you can do something with at the moment.
When I have a motherboard with multiple issues and I can't resolve one, I move onto the other. Often these are related in a way and I end up resolving both.

Does it never have a charging light or does the light dim after the system powers off? From your post I think always?

What's the voltage of <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> and other SMC RESET signals? Often when weird SMC related issues occur this voltage is slightly dropping to somewhere between 2.3 and 2.9V. Also keep an eye on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> with a fast response multimeter, see if it drops

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Turns on but no green light.
threads.message: Alright so <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET</SIGNAL> is a constant 3.4V But <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> is at 2.4V when the machine is off and 1.3V when its on.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Turns on but no green light.
threads.message: that should be at 3.4v all the time. Bad <CHIP>U5010</CHIP>, bad keyboard, leaky <CAPACITOR>C5710</CAPACITOR>, corroded <RESISTOR>R5070</RESISTOR>, or bad SMC. green light isn't on because it thinks you are holding the power button down so it is booting in SMC bypass mode. Good luck hunting!

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Turns on but no green light.
threads.message: This board is going to make me go insane lol. Replaced <CHIP>U5010</CHIP> and <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> is back to 3.4V but booting into SMC bypass. Replaced SMC again with nothing changed, <CAPACITOR>C5710</CAPACITOR> and <RESISTOR>R5070</RESISTOR> looked fine but replaced anyways and still nothing. Is it possible my great donor board SMCS are all dead. :confused:

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Turns on but no green light.
threads.message:
What makes you think it's in bypass mode? System no longer crashing halfway through?

If there is still no light on the charger but the function keys work etc. The SMC is probably fine and you should look into fixing the one wire circuit

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Turns on but no green light.
threads.message: So I came into the store today and went to work on it again. And everything else works fine now. I have no idea why but ill take it. Thanks again everyone for the help.
